question: 包丁
sourceMnemonic: <kanji>Wrap</kanji> up the <kanji>street</kanji> and take it away. I cut it apart with my <vocabulary>kitchen knife</vocabulary> (don't ask why this word comes from these kanji). Just imagine yourself using a kitchen knife to cut up the street so you can wrap it up and take it away.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
